did.abstract: The Library publications record group includes bibliographies, reports, manuals, brochures, maps, guides, handouts, newsletters, posters, information packets, and other publications and ephemera produced by the University of Michigan Library system.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Periodic accessions are regularly received from the library (donor no. 1278).

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open without restriction.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Library (University of Michigan) Publications, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: See the Library Records finding aid for the history of the University of Michigan library system.

scopecontent.p: The University of Michigan Library Publications records group consists of four series: University Library, 1916-2006; Divisional Libraries, 1881-2001; Library Development, ca 1965-2002; and Library Instructional Handouts Set, 1991-1999.

Researchers should note that, with the exception of Illuminator (in the Library Development series), all of the newsletters in the record group are more or less incomplete. More complete runs of certain titles, notably University Library Update, University of Michigan Librarian, and University of Michigan Library Newsletter, are held at the Harlan Hatcher Graduate Library. The University Library System also retains numerous additional library publications within its collections that are not included in this records group. Finally, some University of Michigan library publications (including the three newsletters named above) are catalogued separately within the Bentley Historical Library's holdings.

The University Library, 1916-2006 series consists of materials that were produced either by library administration in general or by sub-units, projects, and programs not affiliated with any particular individual library (with the exception of Library Development, which forms its own series).

odd.p: (Peer Information Counseling and University Library Materials)

scopecontent.p: The Divisional Libraries, 1881-2001 series includes publications from many of the various individual libraries that exist or have existed on campus. It should be noted that, while not technically 'divisional libraries,' materials produced specifically by the Harlan Hatcher Graduate Library and its predecessor the General Library are also included in this series.

did.unittitle: Report-- Renovation of the University of Michigan Undergraduate Library, June 1992

scopecontent.p: The Library Development, ca 1965-2002 series includes materials from the library development office as well as from the Friends of the Library. Highlights of this series are the keepsakes--facsimiles produced by the Friends of the Library from original materials held by Special Collections. Additionally, the series contains bookmarks, brochures, invitations, case statements, reports, the newsletter Illuminator, and fundraising appeals.

did.unittitle: More Room for Books...More Room for Readers: Proposed Graduate Library, The University of Michigan $55 Million Program to Ensure the Vital Margin, circa 1965-1967
Keepsake no. 1: Ancient and Modern Michilimackinac, Including an Account of the Controversy Between Mackinac and the Mormons, by James Jesse Strang, 1856 (facsimile 1987)
Keepsake no. 2: Mitchell's Map of Michigan, 1834 (facsimile December 1988)
Keepsake no. 3: The Fast Mail poster, 1875

odd.p: (also includes note from the director, limited edition note, and color transparency)

did.unittitle: Reports-- A Message from the Director, 2001-2002

scopecontent.p: The series, Library Instructional Handouts Set, 1991-1999, is a series of handouts that arrived from the library as a set. Most of these handouts were printed from the World Wide Web. The handouts are arranged in the order of their accompanying index, a copy of which follows this finding aid as an appendix. The series also includes handouts that were filed with the set; they have been noted as additions in the index.
